author: Ann Van Roy
comment: If you are looking for just a simple list, this feature rich app might be not for you.  If you're looking for a shopping list that allows you to have a different list for every store you go to, while adding (and removing) an item to/from every store's list, having the ability to sort your list by (custom) aisles, then this should be your pick. Of course it takes some time to set up (adding all possible stores to an item, and adding a different aisle for each store). When you set up a list of aisles for each store, each aisle preceded by a 'sorting' number, according to the order in which they are present in the store, shopping can be very fast.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for the kind words. I'm glad you find it useful.

comment: Nothing else like it, best shopping app out there--period! If you are looking for an app like the long gone HandyShopper from the Palm-Pilot days...this is it.

author: Mlchelle Southall
comment: This app has many postive features. It does everything I need it to do. I've tried many other grocery store, buying lists and haven't found a better one. Give it a try.

author: Timothy Marco Chan
comment: My family have been using ths app to orgranize our shopping list and also track the prices of each items we usually buy to get the best deals. The only feature missing for us to show the price per unit in the item list screen and also be able to sort it by price per unit so one glance you know which has the best price.

author: Stanley Hogg
comment: Excellent app.  Very flexible and extremely useful to me.  I've tried a few and this wins hands down.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: I'm glad you find it useful.

author: Monty Pack
comment: Absolutely Great shopping list app. Love the cloud sync. My wife and I just add whatever's needed and whoever goes to the store has the whole list available. Fabulous! Takes a little upfront work to identify which aisles products are in but, once done, the store visit can be arranged by aisle, so it's a quick matter of going only to the necessary aisles and its done. Even if we're both there shopping, we just knock off each item as we get it and the sync let's the other know it's done. So damn handy. EXACTLY what I was looking for!

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for the kind words. I am glad you find it useful.

author: Jenn Davis
comment: Love this! However, is there a way to move it to my SD card? The photos are taking up way to much space in my phone storage. Update: nevermind I figured it out!

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: I'm glad you figured it out.

author: Darrell Butler
comment: It's the best shopping app I've found for those of us who want a robust list of features to really organize our items across multiple stores, categories, include pics, notes, etc.! Takes me back to the beloved Handyshopper.   I tested at least 5 apps in an attempt to replace the no longer working ToMarket. Most were frustratingly too simple and feature limited for me.  An added bonus was the developer's attentive response to convert my ToMarket data to upload into rShopping list!   I haven't tried the "Shop With" subscription feature yet.

Just stumbled onto this after spending countless hours downloading and testing shopping apps. I haven't used it enough yet to write a meaningful review, but just based on the interface design alone, I'm giving it 5 stars, right out of the chute. What a pleasure to use!   Don't get me wrong - this is not a "minimalist" app it's easy to use but it does EVERYTHING. Unlimited stores, and fully configurable Isles, prices, shopping cart etc PER STORE!   Global  labels. Awesome.

author: Dirmansyah Lubis
comment: Good. 5 star app. Can we have an option to disable quick-scroll  button in item list? It keeps on appearing  but I never use it. If I unintentionally touch it ... aarrrgh. Thanks.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for the positive review. I'm glad you find it useful. I will add this option to my TODO list.

author: Jorge Mandango
comment: Used to use Handy Shopper long ago. This app beats it hands down. Absolutely excellent!

author: Bill Starr
comment: I love shopping with this app. The developer kindly converted over my whole list from a similar app I had on my Palm PDA.

author: P Carr
comment: Flexible and can be set up for all kinds of stores and items. Also the developer promptly  replies to questions or suggestions.

author: J Thoma
comment: Great app. However not a fan of the ongoing monthly subscription model for syncing. Would be happy to pay as a one-off however.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for this suggestion. I am glad you find the app useful.

author: Tom Wanamaker
comment: The closest app to Handy Shopper!

rShopping List is my go to app for everyday purchases for food and household items. I use Labels to set up a project which might then have stuff to get from several stores. Drag and drop stores in the order I want to visit them. Use coupon reminder at checkout. Use the calculator to pick best price per unit out of multiple choices. QR code in About for helping others find this app in Play Store. Gets better with every update!

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Wow! Thanks for such a glowing review. You really use a lot of the feature of rShopping List.

comment: Could be more simple to use. Has some silly glitches. If you duplicate an item into another store, it duplicate it in the first store too. When you delete it in the first store, it deletes it from the other store. When you purchase from one store, it still shows as needed in the other. Only able to backup on sd card but not online. Still, the best of a bad lot. Haven't found anything better on Android yet.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for trying rShopping List. The same item may be in multiple stores. When you mark it as needed, it will be included in the list for every store that the item is in. When it is marked as purchased from one store it is purchased at all stores. There no need to duplicate an item just to have it appear in more than one store.

author: Michael Piz
comment: rShopping is a truly magnificent app! It has tons of features, but don't let that stop you. You can start with a single store and a simple list of items, then learn all the ins & outs as you decide you need them. My shopping is a complete breeze now that I have everything set up to take maximum advantage of all the goodies, from making my list to comparing prices to zipping around stores aisle by aisle to checkout to checking my receipt. You want this app!

author: A Google User
comment: I've been using this application for almost 6 years but still no desktop and now has a snyc thats a good thing. Bravo. still waiting for desktop though

author: Nasser Deeb
comment: It's very nice, wish to add an account, so can share in more than one mobile with sane account.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for the kind words. I am glad you find rShopping List useful. You may add accounts to the Shop With... subscription service. Go to Settings>Shop With... and choose "Share Subscription" on both devices. A popup dialog will tell you how to connect the accounts. Thanks for your support.

comment: The ability to flip between sort by aisle (when using the list) and sort alphabetically (when making the list) is particularly useful.

author: Michael Hartman
comment: I use regularly, am generally satisfied, and might recommend. When phone system was updated to Nougat the UPC reader stopped working which was rather frustratingly inconvenient.  A nice feature to have would be a price history so I might determine sales events, and sale prices from the usual prices that a budget or bill estimates should be made from.

author: Charlie Leagra
comment: Removed a star from my previous review. List synching is still missing, 6+ months after it was supposedly being 'final tested' according to an email from the author. It's a shame this key feature is missing from an otherwise really solid app.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: List synchronization is now available in V 2.3.24. Thanks for your patience.

author: Wallace Gilbraith
comment: This app is a delight. Beautifully simple to look at, yet hugely powerful, and so well thought out. Customer service is excellent too - one of my favourite apps

author: Tammy Waggoner
comment: I would have given it 5 stars but the bar code scanner won't work with my new Samsung Galaxy S8. Please fix this.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Thanks for the stars. I am going to add an internal barcode scanner option in a future update.

author: Louie Mader
comment: One of the best shopping lists apps so far.

author: Patrick Polt
comment: Terrific app. Totally customizable and well thought out.
Best shopping list app!

author: Sheryl Tamashiro
comment: This app makes me miss Handyshopper less and less!
Bests shopping app

author: Regina Brown
comment: Perfect replacement for HandyShopper from the old Palm days. Developer is constantly making the app better.

author: Valerie Lee
comment: I LOVE this app, but how do I do the tax percentage??? Please reply OR email me....thanks! ;-)

author: A Google User
comment: Best shopping list app on Android. One of extremely few apps (like ToMarket) that lets you assign more than one store per item. Only thing missing is cloud sync (storing of list) for syncing across devices and ability to add items via Google Now.

author: Lance Eads
comment: The more I use the app, the better I like it and the faster I can do things.  I have been using this app for about a month now and really like its ease of use and flexibilty.     You can update and change things on the fly from a number of screens very easily ( price, store, move items on and off lists, and more so easily).  You can customize the sort order, aisle info, packaging, description, etc.  Once an item is listed, making a store list quickly is a breeze!     Really well designed app!  I might offer suggestions to make it work even better, but I fear it may hurt what works really well now - if it ain't broke . . .

author: DaLiV DaLiV
comment: Best shopping list. but would be nice to have more price possibilities. some items may be sold pro stuck and pro kg, even in one store ... and oft good to knew both prices, as also stores can have periodical actions- and this prices would be nice to have possibility also to note

author: Mary s
comment: Still love it!!

author: Silke Elsner
comment: Love that items can be listed in different stores. If I don't get it in the one I will see it as needed in the other. I can make up my own aisle system with only the items I shop for, it's totally personalized, no cluttering by things I don't shop for. Also, my phone died but the data seemed to have been backed up by Google. I didn't lose anything - big plus.

author: carol dreyer
comment: Back again!  Hoping you are strongly considering an apple iphone version.  I installed and tried most of the apple store apps.  None of them had the all the features I need.  They are not close to matching your app!  March 2017 update:  once I figure out how to set up and use, it's been great! Very useful.  Is there an iPhone version?   Thanks to this app has the ability to take pictures for the item needed and additional notes, I am final free of the 17 yrs of taking my children to stores with me because there is no way they can complain I forgot something or I bought the wrong item.

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Excellent. I am glad to learn that you have it all setup and working the way you like. There is not an iPhone version but if there is enough interest, one may be created.

author: Barbara H
comment: While I still love the design of this app it really is a pain not being able to log onto my computer (at home), look in my pantry, and add items to my shopping list as needed.  I "really" wish there was a way to log in through my computer also.

author: Melanee Allison
comment: Lots of useful features, easy to learn!

reply.author: ((RayDar)) Connected
reply.content: Excellent. I am glad you find it useful.
